Pre-Game Insights: The Marlins and Blue Jays combined for 20 runs last night, and we expect more of the same this afternoon with two subpar hurlers taking the mound.

The Marlins exploded for 15 runs in Friday’s series opener against the Toronto Blue Jays, and we could be in store for another high-scoring game this afternoon as Xzavion Curry and Yariel Rodriguez take the mound for their respective clubs.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. should have some extra motivation today as he enters play needing just one knock to reach the 200-hit milestone for the first time in his career.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The total opened at 8.5 runs, with 70% of bettors opting for the Over.
The Over is 12-6 in Toronto’s last 18 home games and 5-1 in the last six meetings at Rogers Centre.
The Over is 10-1 in Miami’s last 11 games against the American League.
Others: Xzavion Curry has largely pitched out of the bullpen for the Marlins this season, but he’s expected to make his fifth start of the year and first since July 23.
Yariel Rodriguez gave up four hits and three earned runs to the Rays in a losing effort on September 21 — the fourth time in seven starts that he surrendered at least three.
Chris Faria is a betting analyst who has written for several different outlets including Covers and the Canadian Olympic Committee.
